docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Reagan Administration officials said today that they had completed work on a new rule to make experimental drugs more quickly available to patients with AIDS and other ''immediately life-threatening diseases.''

headline.main: U.S. TO ALLOW USE OF TRIAL DRUGS FOR AIDS AND OTHER TERMINAL ILLS >

docs.snippet: LEAD: Reagan Administration officials said today that they had completed work on a new rule to make experimental drugs more quickly available to patients with AIDS and other ''immediately life-threatening diseases.''

keywords.value: HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES, DEPARTMENT OF

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: AS Alfred Steffen lay on an operating room table in Pittsburgh last year, his body rejected the heart that had just been transplanted. Dr. Bartley P. Griffith of Presbyterian-University Hospital gave Mr. Steffen's wife, Joy, a choice: let her husband die or permit doctors to implant an artificial heart until a second human heart could be found.

headline.main: 3 HEART TRANSPLANT PATIENTS: RENEWED AND FULFILLING LIVES

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A CONTROVERSIAL revision of the official diagnostic manual of psychiatry was made available for the first time last week at the annual meeting of the American Psychiatric Association in Chicago.
docs.snippet: LEAD: A CONTROVERSIAL revision of the official diagnostic manual of psychiatry was made available for the first time last week at the annual meeting of the American Psychiatric Association in Chicago.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Nearly one-third of the severe schizophrenics who were given a new drug improved significantly, but the drug requires weekly blood tests because of a potentially fatal side effect, researchers said today.

headline.main: NEW DRUG IS SAID TO HELP SEVERE SCHIZOPHRENICS

docs.snippet: LEAD: Nearly one-third of the severe schizophrenics who were given a new drug improved significantly, but the drug requires weekly blood tests because of a potentially fatal side effect, researchers said today.
